result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J VanCaster was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).
  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).
  • Intimidate Witness/Conspiracy [Modifiers: Conspiracy], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.43(4).
  • Intimidate Witness/Conspiracy [Modifiers: Conspiracy], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.43(4).
  • Intimidate Victim/Conspiracy [Modifiers: Conspiracy], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.45(4).
  • Intimidate Witness/Person Charged/Felony [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.43(7).
  • Intimidate Witness/Person Charged/Felony [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.43(7).
  • Intimidate Witness/Person Charged/Felony [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.43(7).
  • Intimidate Witness/Person Charged/Felony [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.43(7).
  • Intimidate Witness/Person Charged/Felony [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.43(7).
  • Intimidate Witness/Person Charged/Felony [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.43(7).
  • Intimidate Victim/Conspiracy [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.45(4).
  • Intimidate Victim/Conspiracy [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.45(4).
  • Intimidate Victim/Conspiracy [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.45(4).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Substance Abuse programs.
Consecutive to: all counts consecutive

superMiscConds.notes: Complete psychiatric evaluation and follow through

No contact with SRF, ATV,Melanie B., Dalores V., Amber V., Barb H., Ellen K., Lylis J. without prior agent approval
No contact with anyone under the age of 18 without prior agent approval

Complete Sex Offender treatment
Complete Anger Management
Comply with the Wisconsin Sex Offender Registration Program
Submit DNA sample

forwarded to Branch 2 for review

IT IS ORDERED that the judgment of conviction is summarily affirmed. 
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that all motions VanCaster has filed in this court and not yet ruled upon are denied.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Daniel Goggin II is relieved from further representing VanCaster in this appeal.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this summary disposition order will not be published.
